org.ensor.robots.scheduler

Class BioteModule<T extends Biote>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.robots.scheduler.BioteModule<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of Biote we're adding a module to. This type must be derived from the base Biote class, but may be any specific type of Biote.

    public abstract class BioteModule<T extends Biote>
extends Object
    The Biote module class provides the capability to add functionality to a particular Biote without the Biote itself being aware that it carries this functionality. This is specifically useful for adding things like network communications or database functionality to the Biote and allowing it to subscribe and unsubscribe to events which other modules or the Biote itself is not aware of.
    Author:
    Jon

      Constructor and Description
      BioteModule(T aBiote)
      The constructor for a Biote module contains the Biote which it is a part of.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BioteModule

        public BioteModule(T aBiote)
        The constructor for a Biote module contains the Biote which it is a part of. Classes which implement this may perform other operations in the constructor, but will always have access to the Biote they are attached to.
        Parameters:
        aBiote - The Biote that this module should be connected to.
